body:
Could you bisect the issue? And please make sure Alacritty is restarted after disabling font smoothing in the config.

An educated guess would tell me that https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/77f2d6e853f1ad54e6dc844a811b78daeb463e76 is the only thing that could have possibly changed this. So that's probably a good place to check.

Using the font Victor Mono Light on my machine (macOS 10.15.3) makes for a more dramatic difference:

0.4.2: 
![Screen Shot 2020-06-03 at 13 10 19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17414927/83672271-98c85080-a59b-11ea-8964-003569a5d65d.png)


0.4.3: 
![Screen Shot 2020-06-03 at 13 05 04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17414927/83672194-8221f980-a59b-11ea-9a93-a6e7f978ed15.png)

I can do some bisecting starting with 77f2d6e853f1ad54e6dc844a811b78daeb463e76 real quick

rename.from: [macOS] Regression in font rendering in 0.4.3 vs 0.4.2
rename.to: Regression in font rendering in 0.4.3 vs 0.4.2

body: Looks like a good guess, the regression first appears in 77f2d6e853f1ad54e6dc844a811b78daeb463e76. Font looks fine in its parent

Can you try to revert this specific change?

https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/77f2d6e853f1ad54e6dc844a811b78daeb463e76#diff-91c8eb5607beecf6f1ff9718907e2df6
Looks like that does the trick! ~I'll open a quick PR with the revert~
That would break emoji support on macOS unfortunately. We need to look for a different solution than just reverting it.

Oh yes I see that was the point of the PR it was in. It does look _better_ than the screenshots in #1864, but not perfect: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17414927/83676460-50f7f800-a5a0-11ea-9c67-8a0e1027e9ef.png)
Yeah, the transparent parts of an emoji will just always be black without this change.

Note that it might be easy to work around this by checking if the glyph is colored and setting the opacity of the fill color based on that.

The `self.is_colored()` function should be available and is used later in the method anyways, so extracting that into a variable and checking it might just work out.

Are you interested in trying to make this work @thornjad?
I'm interested in trying it out! I'm pretty busy for a few hours but will take a stab at it tonight

FWIW, with `use_thin_strokes: true`, I think fonts look significantly better in 0.4.3 than they did in 0.4.2. If you revert to the old behaviour, it would be great to have a setting that kept the current rendering method :)

> FWIW, with use_thin_strokes: true, I think fonts look significantly better in 0.4.3 than they did in 0.4.2. If you revert to the old behaviour, it would be great to have a setting that kept the current rendering method :)

The goal is to have both. Obviously `use_thin_strokes` should still be working, while the little bug that affects all rendering methods should be resolved.

So the rendering should be identical to setting `defaults write -g CGFontRenderingFontSmoothingDisabled -bool NO` with `use_thin_strokes: true` on 0.4.2.
So switching the background alpha based on `self.is_colored()` does appear to get everything we want for emoji transparency, plus text renders nicely!
Do you know of anything else I should check/test (besides tests and rustfmt) around this fix before opening a PR?

issue.title: Fix font regression on macOS
issue.body:
The `0.0` alpha background works great for emoji, but normal text does not render well on macOS. Instead, use `1.0` for non-pre-colored glyphs.

Fixes #3809

issue.title: [macOS] subpixel/thinstroke make texts look weird
issue.body:
On macOS texts look weird with thin stroke on non-retina screen with system sub pixel. 
I compared the same texts/same font on iterm2.
### System

OS: macOS 10.15.5
Version: v0.4.2
Font: Iosevka 3.1.1 - A condensed font - but look not condensed on Alacritty.

### Settings
- Thin stroke
- `defaults write -g CGFontRenderingFontSmoothingDisabled -bool NO`

### Screenshot
Above is Alacritty, below is iterm2
![Screen Shot 2020-06-01 at 23 00 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38782010/83428186-23099b00-a45c-11ea-9b09-82e50bfc4343.png)

issue.title: Unreadable font without setting size to high value
issue.body: Hello, I have been using Alacritty for a while and I updated yesterday my system installations with brew to find there was a new version available. Nothing wrong until I opened Alacritty next day to find fonts were hard, almost impossible to read in my external monitor. ![Screen Shot 2020-06-09 at 3 33 06 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1834718/84125307-fa584700-aa01-11ea-9a77-47d0e682fa75.png) ![Screen Shot 2020-06-08 at 4 48 38 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1834718/84124091-5d48de80-aa00-11ea-9635-0ce6d114af03.png) My setup is: A macbook pro with retina screen connected to a second ultrawide monitor, it only looks bad in the ultrawide monitor, in the retina screen looks fine. I didn't have the `size` property set before, but to get a better font that I could read normally as before the update, I had to set it to at least `12` to get a decent font definition. This is how it looks set to `12` in the retina screen: ![Screen Shot 2020-06-09 at 3 32 22 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1834718/84125222-db59b500-aa01-11ea-95da-76bea86fd716.png) This is how it looks set to `12` in the ultrawide external screen: ![Screen Shot 2020-06-09 at 3 41 48 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1834718/84126226-4061da80-aa03-11ea-900c-45fb158796a6.png) Tried removing `use_thin_strokes` to see if that makes any change but nothing, only changing the size to higher numbers makes the font readable again. I don't have any problem setting `size` to `12`, but it was not needed before the last update, I'm curious what changed or what I need to do differently now. ### System OS: macOS Catalina 10.15.5 Version: 0.4.3 (c723247) ### Logs **Font/Terminal size:** Without external monitor screen, opened in the retina screen of the macbook pro. ``` alacritty -vv Created log file at "/var/folders/hb/zdwfb9h161l1zx47s8k0y1w00000gn/T/Alacritty-5046.log" [2020-06-09 03:04:52.571141000] [DEBUG] Using environment locale: en_US.UTF-8 [2020-06-09 03:04:52.571339000] [INFO] Welcome to Alacritty [2020-06-09 03:04:52.571367000] [INFO] Configuration loaded from "/Users/gioyik/.alacritty.yml" [2020-06-09 03:04:52.612633000] [DEBUG] Estimated DPR: 2 [2020-06-09 03:04:52.612709000] [DEBUG] Estimated Cell Size: 13 x 26 [2020-06-09 03:04:52.612735000] [DEBUG] Estimated Dimensions: None [2020-06-09 03:04:53.602634000] [INFO] Device pixel ratio: 2 [2020-06-09 03:04:53.607986000] [INFO] Initializing glyph cache... [2020-06-09 03:04:53.652406000] [INFO] ... finished initializing glyph cache in 0.044293613s [2020-06-09 03:04:53.652504000] [INFO] Cell Size: 13 x 26 [2020-06-09 03:04:53.652535000] [INFO] Padding: 0 x 0 [2020-06-09 03:04:53.652561000] [INFO] Width: 1600, Height: 1200 [2020-06-09 03:04:53.652640000] [INFO] PTY Dimensions: Line(46) x Column(123) [2020-06-09 03:04:53.658151000] [INFO] Initialisation complete [2020-06-09 03:05:02.442563000] [INFO] Goodbye Deleted log file at "/var/folders/hb/zdwfb9h161l1zx47s8k0y1w00000gn/T/Alacritty-5046.log" ``` Opened in an external ultrawide monitor screen, not the retina screen of the macbook pro. ``` alacritty -vv Created log file at "/var/folders/hb/zdwfb9h161l1zx47s8k0y1w00000gn/T/Alacritty-14061.log" [2020-06-09 03:34:01.742990000] [DEBUG] Using environment locale: en_US.UTF-8 [2020-06-09 03:34:01.746124000] [INFO] Welcome to Alacritty [2020-06-09 03:34:01.746159000] [INFO] Configuration loaded from "/Users/gioyik/.alacritty.yml" [2020-06-09 03:34:01.783261000] [DEBUG] Estimated DPR: 1 [2020-06-09 03:34:01.783339000] [DEBUG] Estimated Cell Size: 6 x 13 [2020-06-09 03:34:01.783368000] [DEBUG] Estimated Dimensions: None [2020-06-09 03:34:01.831313000] [INFO] Device pixel ratio: 1 [2020-06-09 03:34:01.834795000] [INFO] Initializing glyph cache... [2020-06-09 03:34:01.865708000] [INFO] ... finished initializing glyph cache in 0.030789706s [2020-06-09 03:34:01.865779000] [INFO] Cell Size: 6 x 13 [2020-06-09 03:34:01.865804000] [INFO] Padding: 0 x 0 [2020-06-09 03:34:01.865827000] [INFO] Width: 800, Height: 600 [2020-06-09 03:34:01.865897000] [INFO] PTY Dimensions: Line(46) x Column(133) [2020-06-09 03:34:01.869283000] [INFO] Initialisation complete [2020-06-09 03:34:15.197727000] [INFO] Goodbye Deleted log file at "/var/folders/hb/zdwfb9h161l1zx47s8k0y1w00000gn/T/Alacritty-14061.log" ``` (here `size` is not set to any value) ![Screen Shot 2020-06-09 at 3 34 36 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1834718/84125449-2d9ad600-aa02-11ea-98da-f8e0aaa993df.png) ### Configuration file ``` live_config_reload: true dimensions: x: 80 y: 80 position: x: 10 y: 10 cursor: style: Block scrolling: history: 0 # Colors (Dracula) colors: # Default colors primary: background: '#282a36' foreground: '#f8f8f2' # Normal colors normal: black: '#000000' red: '#ff5555' green: '#50fa7b' yellow: '#f1fa8c' blue: '#caa9fa' magenta: '#ff79c6' cyan: '#8be9fd' white: '#bfbfbf' # Bright colors bright: black: '#575b70' red: '#ff6e67' green: '#5af78e' yellow: '#f4f99d' blue: '#caa9fa' magenta: '#ff92d0' cyan: '#9aedfe' white: '#e6e6e6' font: normal: family: Hack Nerd Font style: Regular bold: family: Hack Nerd Font style: Bold italic: family: Hack Nerd Font style: Italic size: 12.0 draw_bold_text_with_bright_colors: true # hardcore mode key_bindings: - { key: Left, action: None } - { key: Right, action: None } - { key: Up, action: None } - { key: Down, action: None } ```
